intro: Lotodes digitatum, commonly known as the water lily, is a aquatic plant characterized by its floating leaves and showy flowers. It belongs to the family Nymphaeaceae and is native to freshwater habitats in tropical and subtropical regions. The plant has broad, rounded leaves that float on the water surface, while its roots are submerged in the sediment. Its flowers are typically white or pink, with a distinctive central yellowish spot. The plant plays an important role in aquatic ecosystems by providing habitat and oxygen to water organisms.
